item.title: Sainsmart RYC GRBL V2 Upgrade
item.description: GRBL has been optimized for Ardunio’s ATmega328p. So most configurations out there will use the Arduino Uno and a CNC shield. I decide to go with the Sainsmart RYC-GRBL-V2 hoping it would work out of the box. The reason why this is a long post is because it didn’t work out of the box. To get it up and running these are the list of things I changed to get it working.

item.title: Upgrading K40 Controller
item.description: K40 Laser Engraver Upgrades Add Switch to change between manual power, and PWM power add in a switch to switch between a potentiometer and the PWM power from the laser for the IN line on LPS” K40 Laser Engraver Controller Board Upgrades PiBot Raspberry Pi CNC Hat V2.60 - GRBL v1.1 Compatable - Uses Pololu Stepper Drivers Look for this 2.6V https://www.ebay.com/itm/Raspberry-Pi-CNC-Hat-V2-60-GRBL-v1-1-Compatable-Uses-Pololu-Stepper-Drivers/271901344091?hash=item3f4e95415b:g:bhsAAOSwZLZaTWn~ Smoothieboard - fork off GRBL

item.title: Shower Pan
item.description: Shower Pan Construction Material Needed Shower rough valve Framing and Plumbing Shower Pan Shower pan use packed dry mud on bottom layer 5 to 1 mixture of sand and Portland cement clay like mixture that hold its shape when packed Top mortar layer should be 1 1/2” - 2” thick at the drain Notes about different layers of mortars Thin is a recipe for failure.
